title: Blind Stored XSS Payload fired at the backend on https://‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà/
vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
I have just gotten an email notification from my XSSHunter payload that my blind stored XSS has been triggered by an administrator on the ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà site, in the following URL:

```javascript
https://‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà/‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
```

Admin IP address: 
‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

User-Agent:
‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

Cookies:
```javascript
‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà
```
Injection Image:

‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

DB Creds exposed:

‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà.‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà\‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñàa

## Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions

Sanitizing the input on the back-end as well

##Best Regards
nagli

## Impact

Ability to capture administrator action when preforming activities on the back-end.
Extractions of DB credentials.
Access to private information.
Stealing the cookies of the administrator.

activities.message:
Greetings from the Department of Defense (DoD),

Thank you for supporting the DoD Vulnerability Disclosure Program (VDP).

By submitting this report, you acknowledge understanding of, and agreement to, the DoD Vulnerability Disclosure Policy as detailed at @DeptofDefense.

The VDP Team will review your report to ensure compliance with the DoD Vulnerability Disclosure Policy.  If your report is determined to be out-of-scope, it will be closed without action.

We will attempt to validate in-scope vulnerability reports and may request additional information from you if necessary. We will forward reports with validated vulnerabilities to DoD system owners for their action.

Our goal is to provide you with status updates not less than every two weeks until the reported vulnerability is resolved.

Regards,

The VDP Team

activities.message:
The injection point was from an exam that I have taken here:
https://‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà/

Greetings,

To validate [your report] [the reported vulnerability], We require additional information.

Can you please answer the following questions?

‚Ä¶Could you tell me the exam, and which field you used as your injection point.  Sometimes it takes a bit to verify these blind xss attacks and I just want to try and duplicate exactly what you have done.

I will continue processing your report on receipt of your response.  You will receive another status update upon completion of this review.  If I have any other questions in the interim, I will be back in touch.  

If we do not receive a response within two weeks, we will send you a second request for this information.  If we do not receive a response from you within two weeks of the second notice, we will have to close this report without action. 

If you have any questions, please let me know.

Thanks again for supporting the DoD Vulnerability Disclosure Program.

Regards,

@agent-j5

You could just ask the administrator to go again to 

https://‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà/‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

And my payload will trigger.

@nagli   Just wanted to give you a quick update, I am attempting to reproduce your findings but when submitting the evaluation it fails to submit.  I will attempt it again later in the day to see if I get different results.

@agent-j5 
Can you share the video / do you have a point of contact to access the internal page?

This is a screenshot of what I get when I submit the evaluation.  We do not have direct contact with the page admins as we only validate the reports.  I will continue trying to submit later in the day but have to do the eval all over and as you know you can't copy and paste the answers in on the site.

I see,
But anyway I have supplied enough information that should be valid for triage I assume.

@nagli , I just wanted to let you know I was finally able to submit my eval.  Just waiting on them to hit my xsshunter.  With this being a high severity I wanted to do my due diligence before passing it forward.

@agent-j5

Sweet, just for you to know that it took 2 month for my payload to fire.

And if escelation with the creds I dumped could be made with the owners I think the severity could rise to critical.

Thanks üïµÔ∏è

@nagli 
If it doesn't fire for me by end of today I will check with managers to see if I can forward it based on what you have posted here.  I don't want to hold it up if it took that long to fire for you.

@agent-j5

Sure, I really doubt it.
I have supplied the exact affected URI,so reproducing it should be easy.

Thanks.

Greetings,

We have validated the vulnerability you reported and are preparing to forward this report to the affected DoD system owner for resolution.

Thank you for bringing this vulnerability to our attention!

We will endeavor to answer any questions the system owners may have regarding this report; however, there is a possibility we will need to contact you if they require more information to resolve the vulnerability.

You will receive another status update after we have confirmed your report has been resolved by the system owner. If you have any questions, please let me know.

Thanks again for supporting the DoD Vulnerability Disclosure Program.

Regards,

The VDP Team

Just to let you know it fired again from the same location, different ip.

‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

@agent-j5
Hi, it fired another 15 times today.
And it showed me a new endpoint where you can actually see my payloads:

https://‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà/‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

I think this is authentication bypass as well because i can see all the surveys ever taken in an endpoint which should be authenticated.
Should I report it as another issue?

There is also probably SQLI on that page

{‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà:}

Thank you for the updates, it has yet to fire for me but as you said it took a long time for you.  As you know it can take a long time for them to fix this issue but you will be updated as soon as it is resolved.

@agent-j5
Now with the new endpoint you can verify for yourself, just complete any test and inject it on the notes, go to the https://‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà/‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà and you can execute it.
Thank you, it is already triaged and when they work on it this will make testing easier.
Researcher never responded back.

@agent-j5
You made a mistake
closed by mistake

Greetings,

We have validated the vulnerability you reported and are preparing to forward this report to the affected DoD system owner for resolution.

Thank you for bringing this vulnerability to our attention!

We will endeavor to answer any questions the system owners may have regarding this report; however, there is a possibility we will need to contact you if they require more information to resolve the vulnerability.

You will receive another status update after we have confirmed your report has been resolved by the system owner. If you have any questions, please let me know.

Thanks again for supporting the DoD Vulnerability Disclosure Program.

Regards,

The VDP Team

Just leaving it in NMI for a day or so. If we dont get a hit back we will go ahead and close this resolved. Then if you get something in another 2 months you can resubmit haha. so far we have nothing coming back.
Sure @agent-l8  :-)

Mannn if you respond it takes it out of needs more info! haha all good, no response, we are going to close this one for now as its believed to be fixed- if you get another hit, submit a new ticket plz. Thanks!

Sorry!

I need to hunt again on the DoD soon, was on a break from you program to score some bounties  :-)
we get it, we are often used as a platform to get invited to paid- but much appreciated when good hunters come back to us :) disclosure added to queue

Thanks for participating in the DoD Vulnerability Disclosure Program. We're publicly disclosing your resolved report at this time.  We also lock the report on the disclosure but feel free to reach out to us at VDP-Questions@dc3.mil if there are any questions, concerns or issues.
